line.en: 'Phew'.'
With a thud I throw my body on my bed.
My entire body feels heavy. An exhaustion I've\nnever felt before.
But still... my heart is on fire.
When I close my eyes, I can still recall the that\nsweet sensation in my hands, on my skin and\nnether region.
'We really...'
Me... Ageha... we did it...
That wasn't a dream was it?
When it suddenly began to rain... at the secret\nbase, we... did it.
'Hmmm.'
He breasts, her skin, her groin... remembering\nevery small detail made me rolling around on the\nbed.
Wait, I need to calm down. I've already sorted\nout all my emotions about her and now should have\nbeen perfectly calm by now.
Everything ended, and we were returning to\nnormal.
But in place of passion we started to feel\nextreme shinesess.

Not being able to look into each other's eyes, we
hastly put on our clothes. The feeling of cool
air on my skin seems to let me return to my
senses.
'I... I'll be going. See you tomorrow!'
I didn't say anything, and Ageha quickly left\nlike she was running away.
I tried to chase after her, but by the time I\nwent outside she was too far away.
The rain has stopped, and while returning home\nunder the clear evening sky, I got a email.
Is it from Ageha?
We're hungry, come back ASAP!" \ from my friends\nin the dorm.
Well, me being here at this time means I'm not\ndoint my work in the dorm.
And because making dinner is more important than\ncleaning or making breakfast, everyone became\nquite angry.
From now I won't have time to think about Ageha \\nI'll be busy like a bee.
Late in the evening, when it was my turn to use a\nbath, it came to me.
'It was... for real...'
It was neither daydream nor illusion.
I really had sex with Ageha.
Yeah, with that Ageha.
Whom I know from long ago.
And who is my close friend.
Ageha, whom I loved and confessed to long time\nago...
Not "loved".
Not in past tense.
Lately she was always on my mind.
When I try to ogranize my feeling about her now,\nI don't have any doubts: this is love.
And it's not the same love I was feeling as a\nchild.
The relation that is more than friendship, that\nnaturally allows sex, the most intimate relation\nin the world...
Lovers.
Sweethearts.
There is no doubt.
I love Ageha.
From long ago, I love her more than anyone else.
And that's why I wasn't able to resist even the\nslightest temptation.
If it wasn't her, I absolutely wouldn't have done\nsuch a thing.
But it was Ageha.
The girl I love!
'Yes... that's it...'
But what a strange feeling.
I remember how happy was Masatsugu when he\nmanaged to get a girfriend. He was always\nfollowing Akari-san around.
Fevirish gaze, high-pitched voice, unusual\nbehavior...
Am I becoming like that too?
'Hmmm.'
No, probably not.
When I recall Ageha's passionate voice, naked\nbody, soft skin \ I can't help getting excited.
But that feeling of wanting to fly into the sky\ndoesn't come.
Because of Ageha.
We're too close.
Being close is natural for us.
We didn't think of our relation as something\nspecial.
I love Ageha.
As a woman, and as a sweetheart \ I love her.
What we did today is a proof.
There's no way back after what happened.
And I don't need it.
I want to advance our relationship.
From just a childhood friend to a couple.
We're not strangers anymore!
I found myself smiling and slapped my cheeks.
Then opened the window and looked up into the\nsky.
The moon drifted above, casting pale light onto\nthe world wrapped in hot air.
I'll fly into this sky, together with Ageha!
'Oh?'
Email at this time? Don't tell me...
'Ooh!'
Yes, it's from Ageha!
I think I can understand Masatsugu's feelings a\nbit.
What's this email about I wonder? Good night\nmessage? Profession of love? Definitely something\nsweet.
Trembling with excitement, I read the text.
'...What?'
'Tomorrow I'm going to go first, OK.'
'...That's it?'
Maybe she's embarrassed.
Yeah that's it.
That must be it.
Mmm... but... maybe...
Maybe she's regretting we got into that kind of\nrelation?
Or maybe I was too rough at moving my hips, she\ndidn't like it and now hates me?
Nah, that can't be it, Ageha wouldn't.
But how can I know? It was the first time for\nboth of us.
Maybe she regrets it and this blunt e-mail is an\nexpression of her desire to forget it.
Nah, nah, that can't be it.
There's no one I can discuss this with and so I\nfret over it all night.
Before I know it, it's already morning. This is\nhorrible.
'Whaa!'
'You're late.'
'Sorry, I'll make breakfast right away!'
'Ah it can't be helped. It's the last day of\nexams so everyone's in the same boat.'
'Mumble, mumble, mumble.'
'See, look at this high strung individual.'
'Do you want breakfast?'
'Don't talk to me, I'll forget the words.'
'Ah, sorry.'
'1648 Westphalia, 1689 Bill of Rights, 1713\nUtrecht, 1748 Aachen, 1763 Paris...'
'I don't want to fail, I can't fail, I mustn't\nfail. I will pass, I will graduate, graduate,\ngraduating class, class...'
'The rain in Spain stays mainly in the plain.\nKlein bottle, body line on the Rhine. Bine, bine,\nbon, bon... ahahaha!'
Wow, everyone's eyes look crazy.
Ah it makes sense that they would think me\noversleeping was normal.
I can't say the real reason so this is fortunate.
'Good morning. You're slow today. Get a move on\nwith the breakfast, OK?'
The only one's who aren't feeling pressure are\nKotori and one half of the Kazato sisters.
Of course for our part, Kotori and I have a\npractical exam today for which you can't actually\ndo any late night cramming.
'Please God, rewind time!'
'Even if he did turn back time you'd just waste\nit again, right?'
'Please God, rewind time after the exam\nfinishes.'
'In other words you want to cheat?'
'But if that happened then everybody's results\nwould be the same.'
'Please God, just for me. Rewind time after the\nexam finishes.'
'...If you're going to pray for something,\nwouldn't it be easier to pray that your exam\npaper gets misplaced.'
'That's it! If the school doesn't exist there's\nno problem. Of course! I just have to make the\nschool and teachers disappear!'
'Calm down!'
Ah chaos.
'Alright. Last day. Let's do this.'
'Yep.'
'Ageha hasn't come, hey?'
'...Yeah'
'Hotaru either. Ah well it can't be helped\ntoday...'
'I'm not good at practical subjects, so I was\nhoping to get a little advice.'
'Even if you got some at this stage it wouldn't\nhelp much.'
'Yeah, yeah. It must be nice to be naturally\ntalented.'
'Don't sulk. It's not like it's easy for me\neither.'
'Hasn't Ageha been teaching you various things?!'
I can manage to stay calm if it's just hearing\nAgeha's name, but that kind of expression gets\nme.
Various things"... hearing that brings back those\npeachy memories.
I swiftly shake my head and try to clear my mind.
'What's wrong?'
'Nothing...'
'Are you that nervous?'
Ah, thankfully she got the wrong idea.
But of course she did. I mean me and Ageha...
She's more than aware that Ageha and I were alone\ntogether at the secret base.
Kotori, the Kazato sisters, everyone in the\ndorm,\ here's no indication that anyone suspects\nsomething happened between us.
I'm grateful for the fact that everyone trusts me\nbut...
Soon I'm going to be sweeping away this image of\nbeing 'safe'.
Anyway, I wonder if... Ageha is in the\nclassroom...
'Wha!'
'Whaaaaa!'
'Gyaaaahh!'
As Ageha comes plowing into us, Kotori lets off a\nscream.
'Oops... sorry Kotori.'
'What about me?!'
'You're fine.'
Again I come face to face with Ageha.
She's wearing her uniform.
The clothes that were soaked yesterday.
Ageha clearly averts her gaze away from me.
Looking at the ground near my feet she seems to\nbe asking me not to look at her.
But then... in the next instant.
'Well anyway, good morning, Aoi!'
...Just like usual, too much like usual, she's\nback to the old Ageha Himegi.
'Oh... uh... good morning...'
'Alright then. Exam time. Kotori, you ready?'
'As long as I don't have to take supplemental\nsubjects I'll be fine. Even I should be able to\ndo this much.'
'Good work, being able to grasp that much. If\nyou're going to fly, that sort of judgment is\nimportant.'
'Right, Aoi?'
To be honest I didn't expect to be brushed off\nlike this.
'Um, ah... yeah I guess...'
'Riiiight?'
There isn't a trace of concern in Ageha's eyes.
That bothers me even more.
Kotori is in her wheelchair, so as long as she\ndoesn't turn around she can't see my face.
Using this to my advantage I stare straight at\nAgeha.
There's no way she hasn't noticed my gaze, but\nshe doesn't react at all.
'Let's get this silly exam out the way, build our\nglider and fly, yeah?'
'Hey! Shh! Shh!'
We can't talk about the glider at school!
'Oops!'
Breaking into a cold sweat I look around us.
If Tobioka was walking passed it'd be real bad.
...Seems like nobody overheard.
'Be careful!'
'Yeah, sorry.'
'Are you nervous?'
'Well it is my best subject so that actually\nmakes me more nervous.'
'You don't strike me as that kind of person.'
'Well I'm actually a big coward, see.'
'Don't lie.'
'I am right, Aoi?'
'Huh, uh, yeah, I guess you also have that\naspect. Nah, actually I think I'd say you've got\nguts.'
Again, feeling completely brushed off, I\nreflexively think back to staring at her\nyesterday.
Then, without thinking I give this kind of\nanswer.
'Guts?'
'I think he means I have a big stomach.'
'Ah right, big thighs too.'
'You can talk Kotori, your waist has grown 2cm\nrecently.'
'Wha?! How do you know that?!'
'For my part I have managed to stay in fine form.\nActually I probably look better than before the\nexams.'
'Mmmm.'
'Something wrong?'
'Your skin's looking really rough. Have you been\nawake all-night?'
'Heh, heh, heh, well spotted young Kotori.'
'Who are you trying to be?'
'Because I'm hiding something I've been too\nnervous and excited to sleep.'
She couldn't sleep... does that mean, could it\nbe...?
'If you can't sleep before a test how are things\ngoing to be for the real deal?'
Real deal?!
Of course she doesn't mean what I'm thinking.
'Well, I'm sure it'll work out.'
While my heart rate is racing, Ageha is totally\nunfazed and replies with a smile.
'OK everyone, I know you're all excited. So, it's\ntime for the test to officially begin.'
'Aaahhh... no time to review!...'
'It's a practical test so it wouldn't make any\ndifference.'
'But still! No time to calm my nerves, I can't do\nimage training. I need some image training.'
'In that case leave it to me.'
'...What can you do?'
'Hoo yah!'
'Ah!'
Ageha gives Kotori a Karate chop to the head.
'What are you doing?!'
'There you go Kotori. You feel bad now, right?'
'Because you don't feel so good, ask the\ninstructor if you she'll change the order. Then\nyou can go after me.'
With practical exams we normally go in seating\norder.
So in a normal situation Kotori Habane would go\nbefore Ageha Himegi.
But if the order is changed.
'I'll show you a perfect example and, watching\nthat, you can do image training. So relax, okay?'
'Ah... thank you.'
I'm completely left out of the conversation.
In the end I don't get a chance to talk to Ageha\nproperly.
And of course, after entering the class, other\nthan in the corridor there isn't any opportunity\nto talk to her.
Even if I tried to talk to her in private, it's\nnot something I can talk about with other people\naround...
'Alright, let's begin the test. When I call your\nname please come to the front.'
Because I can't talk to her all I can do is\nfollow Ageha with my eyes.
'Hahaha, the test is finished! I've been set\nfree!'
'Yeah... the tests are over... a lot of things...\nare over...'
Black and white, completely.
Kotori did everything she could, she gave a\nperformance better than in any practical classes.
Compared to me, who normally performs decently in\nclass, being distracted by other thoughts I gave\na horrendous performance.
'Aoi, I thought you'd be the type to rise to the\ncall when it came to the real deal. I'm a little\nsurprised.'
'Yeah... I just choked a little...'
And then there's one more.
The reason for my poor performance, on the\nopposite side of the wheelchair, trudging along.
'Yeeeaah...'
'Well I can understand Aoi, but why did you mess\nup, Ageha?'
'I have no excuse.'
'Even the most masterful expert will fail once in\na thousand tries. I guess for me today may have\nbeen that day.'
'Well, anyway, I managed to perform at a level\nrare for me. So I'm really happy about that.'
'I sure hope you guys don't fail. If you fail in\nthe practical classes, Ageha, you might not\npass.'
'Don't say that!...'
'Yeah, seriously!...'
'With this the Soaring Club is in a bit of a\npinch!'
And then I have a flash of inspiration.
'Us two losers need to discuss our failure so...\nyou head off without us...'
'Huh?'
'Ah... O, OK, no problem...'
Kotori, despite having got the best grade,\nawkwardly goes off ahead.
Ageha and I hang behind.
'Can we talk for a bit?'
Ageha, despite being a bit surprised, doesn't\nresist and walks with me.
'Sorry... feels like I forced this on you.'
'Nah it's OK. We are both losers today, so.'
'Yeah...'
'So... I guess it was because of... that?'
'The reason I choked?'
'Yeah... that's right.'
'I couldn't stop thinking of you so. I wasn't\nable to concentrate on anything else, you know?'
'I see.'
'It was the same for you, right? That's why you\nmessed up on such an easy test?'
'Yeah... I guess so.'
Ageha's face turns red ever so slightly.
'Trying to forget something like that... I guess\nit's impossible...'
'Right?!'
'Hey, don't yell, it's embarrassing...'
'Ah sorry.'
'But that was really amazing.'
'For me too... it was the best...'
'It was painful, but when I recall it now... it\nmakes me happy...'
'And when you started to move... it was so hot...\nmy head stopped working...'
'Oh my... what I'm saying... uh...'
It's natural to have erection after hearing such\nthings!
Looking at her now bashful face now, I've\nremembered her yesterday's passionate expression,\nand my body reacted in no time.
Ageha also stole a glance at my groin.
'Has it become big?'
'Well, that's...'
'Okay...'
Now she was openly staring at my nether region\nthat became even bigger.
'That's amazing...'
Ageha's throat has moved.
And she's rubbing her thighs together.
'*Gulp*'
My throat also became parched.
No no no! I shaked my head in panic.
'No, that's not it... that's not what I'm talking\nabout... I mean, this is included, but you\nknow...'
'Ah... you mean...'
'Now... you want to do it again... is that it?'
To be honest I can't deny that my heart jumps out\nof my chest.
But...
'Um I mean, that would be nice bu...'
I'm trying to show that I'm calm and collected\nbut I stammer.
'I mean, um, like.'
Ah why am I sweating like this?
'Before that I want to get something clear.'
'What?'
I quickly look around to make sure no one's\naround. Good, there's no one.
'Well... actually, um.'
Whoa, I'm sweating even more.
Compared to getting caught in a downward air\ncurrent and being pulled to the earth, this kind\nof thing...
...But still my heart races faster.
'I mean we, we did that so...'
'We did.'
'Don't say it so calmly!'
'So I've been thinking this for a long time. We\nshould go out for real.'
'For real?'
'Yeah for real. Like a boyfriend and girlfriend.'
For some reason Ageha acts as if she's deep in\nthought.
'What would change if we became boyfriend and\ngirlfriend?'
'Huh?'
Instead of saying 'OK' she's asking a question?
'Well... like... we'd always be together...'
'We're together right now, right?'
'Go out on dates.'
'We went out the other day and had fun, right?'
'We'd go to each other's houses.'
'We're always doing that now.'
'We'd... have sex...'
'We did it too.'
'Let's do it again next time'
'I don't mean it like that...'
I was gettin anxious.
Why does Ageha react like this?
And I thought she'll just say "okay".
Surely what we did is restricted to couples, it's\ncommon sense.
'Anyway, Ageha... I love you.'
'...Uh huh.'
'I love you more than anyone.'
'More than an old friend, more than best friends,\nI want to progress further...'
After I take a deep breath I say clearly.
'I want to be your boyfriend!'
'I want to go out with you from now on!'
'I didn't realize it before. I asked you before I\nreally understood.'
'But my feelings are the same as then. You're the\nmost important. The person I like more than\nanyone!'
'I want us to feel the same level of need for\neach other. I want us to have that kind of\nrelationship!'
'Haa, haa, haa, haa...'
My breath is labored and I'm sweating more than\nafter the most intense running race.
For a while I can't control my breathing.
'Haa, haa, haa, haa...'
I've said all I intended to say so now all there\nis to wait for Ageha's response.
'Hmmm... Um... Well... Hmmm... !'
Ageha looks from left to right.
She looks much more flustered that when we\nkissed.
...Why is she flustered?
'Um... well... like... Uh...'
'Well!'
As if she's made up her mind she looks straight\nat me.
I swallow hard and wait for her answer.

I feel like I'm watching a player from my
favorite soccer team make a break and shoot for
goal. That moment before breaking out into
elation.
Soon I'll have a girlfriend.
I want to show a live broadcast of this moment to\nthe all boys school I went to before.
I'm going to go out with the girl I like the\nmost!
At that moment Ageha begins to move her sweet\nlips.
'Let me think about it.'
She just said yes, right? She's going to say she\nlikes me, agree to it, we're going to officially\nbe boyfriend and girlfriend.

'Nah, I don't mean that it won't happen or
anything. It's just we might have to deal with
supplemental exams, so I think we should put it
off until later.'
'And then after that we have to finish the\nglider. Then we'll fly through the Morning Glory,\nright?!'
'So after that's all over, we'll talk about it.\n...Okay?'
'Ah... sure...'
'OK then I'm off! Soon we'll have to fly for real\nso let's do our best!'
'Yeah...'
I wave my hand as if following Ageha's lead.
And then she disappears.
I stand there motionless.
Pale. Everything goes white as if bleached out by\nthe sunlight.
'What... what the... fuck...'
At my feet my dripping sweat changes the color of\nthe ground.
'One, two...'
'We're finished!'
Everyone holds up their glasses in joyful\ncelebration.
It's over! These stressful times. These days of\nhardship The finals are over!
'As I expected, it's different compared to normal\nschools. I can't believe how many practical exams\nwe had.'
'But you did them so easily. Pretty impressive.'
'You know it!'
'It was a hard battle for me.'
'I've heard that twins are either remarkably\nsimilar or complete opposites. I guess it's\ntrue.'
'I did better than I ever have up until now. I\nfelt totally in control.'
'Nice.'
'Heh heh, as the leader... I guess this is\nnatural...'
'Ssssssss'
I almost make a sinking noise as I try to fade\ninto the background.
'Hey, you trying to create a black hole there in\nthe corner. What do you have to say for\nyourself.'
'Did he do that badly?'
'That's a bit unexpected. I thought you were the\ntype to pull through when it was necessary.'
'I did what I had to... what I needed to...\nbut...'
'What are you mumbling about? I can't hear you?'
'Nothing... I'm going to cook...'
I blankly stand up and, turning my back to\neveryone and head towards the kitchen.
Right now, I don't care what, I want to put my\nhands to work on something.
'Hmm?'
'Yo. I hear your finals are over. Here, a few\nprovisions for you.'
'Thanks... Ah'
I can probably ask An-chan about Ageha and me.
'Ah yeah, I bumped into these guys on the way so\nI gave them a lift.'
'Hi ho!'
'Sorry to intrude.'
'Hmm?'
An-chan notices that I've frozen up and then\nnotices me looking at Ageha.
'You choked in the exams, huh? Ah well, don't\nworry.'
'Well don't be late for work tomorrow, OK?'
...I wanted to talk to him but he heads off\nstraight away...
'Hey everyone, we got presents from An-chan, help\nus out.'
Leaving me behind, Ageha walks straight in, in an\nunusually good mood.
'Hi, hi, thanks for inviting me to the party!'
'We've got a whole lot of watermelons and ice\ncream from An-chan.'
'Wow!'
'Ah and this is from us, Chinese dumplings from\nTasaki's!'
'Ooo!'
'Great!'
'Hmm there's kind of nothing stimulating...'
'We've been released from exams. We don't need\nanything stimulating, we need delicious stuff.'
'Yeah but still. We need some kind of excitement.\nWhere's the female appeal? Don't you have any\nsaucy stories you can tell?'
'Ah, you want to hear stories. If that's the case\nI have some doozies. I've collected a whole bunch\nof rumors.'
Kotori puts her mouth close to Yoru's ear.
She starts whispering something.
'And then, at that moment...'
'Really? Wha...?'
'And then, after that... using fingers... like\nthat...'
'Wha... that's awful!'
'Awful? Unlawful?'
'Hey you come here too, Asa. I'll let you in on\nsome fascinating things.'
'Wait, no! Kanako, her ears will be defiled. Her\nsoul will be polluted, she will fall from being\npure of heart to licentious and obscene!'
'Really? I'm only just getting started.'
'Don't drag people down to the gutter!'
'Alright then, let's all get naked.'
'Wha?!'
'It's not fair if only we do it, so everyone join\nin. We'll start off from Yoru!'
'Are you drunk?! You've been drinking, haven't\nyou?!'
'Actually I haven't had a drop.'
'Then that's even worse!'
'Yah, Yoru is about to take the first step\ntowards exposing her attributes!'
'Stop it!'
Everyone seems to have completely forgotten that\nI'm a guy.
'Wow, in a household full of women everyone\nforgets their shame pretty quick.'
The person who's exposing herself the most here\nis you!
That's what I would usually say, but...
'Can I... talk to you later?'
I whisper so no one else can hear.
'Nope.'
'Why?'
'Because what I have to say won't change. So\nthere's no point in having the same conversation\nover and over.'
'But!'
'Do you hate me now?'
'Of course not!'
'Ah that's good. I was a little worried.'
'So in other words... your answer is 'yes'?'
'Like I said we'll talk about that later.'
'I don't understand.'
'Hmmm, I really wish you would.'
'I said all that stuff before. After that all\nthat's left is your answer.'
'Hmmm...'
'What are you two conspiring?'
'We are consoling each other for being in a pinch\nwith exams.'
'I can't believe you guys. Honestly, things are\ngoing to get serious from now. If you guys have\nto back out we're dead.'
'We know, we know.'
'... Ah, since you're here Kotori, I want you to\nknow something.'
I'll say my feelings one more time in front of\neveryone.
If I do that, even Ageha can't run away.
'What, something happened?'
'Well actually, I...'
'Yaaaah, stop it.'
'Yaaaah!'
'Hahaha, it's fine stop stressing.'
'Heh heh, so soft, so smooth, so cute.'
'Hey guys, you're going a bit far.'
'Now that we're at it.'
'Ooh, flying into the fire, a couple of melting\nsoldering irons.'
'Whaa!'
The older girls have started to run wild.
'Hey, stop it please!'
'Wha. This is no good. The only one who can stop\nthose two now is the ol' Aoi. OK everyone let's\ncall ol' Aoi.'
'Your way of speaking is weird, too.'
'OK girls let's all call on the ol' Aoi. One,\ntwo!'
'Aoi, help!'
The two older girls have turned their poisonous\nfangs towards Hotaru.
'Hey you two, quit it! Stop!'
'Ah, there's the perfect prey.'
'Time for a dry run! Time for practice!'
'What kind of practice are you talking about?!'
'The kind of practice we need to do for when we\nhave a boyfriend.'
'That's not something you can practice! Wait a\nsecond. That's not, you can't, hey don't touch my\nclothes!'
'You've come all the way here and now you're\ndriving us away? You're mean. There's nothing for\nit except your dissection.'
'Right. Let's all do it together.'
'Well if you say so.'
'Shall we pull them off...? Can we do that?...'
Wow, it's like they became zombies.
'You should never underestimate the hostility of\ngirls who can't get boyfriends.'
'Who are you trying to be? What exactly is it\nyou're trying to do?'
'I am the person who is always on the side of\nthose who are funny.'
'Well aren't you something.'
'Ah, Aoi is in a pinch.'
'Alright , let's all grab him at the same time.\nThat way we'll all be the same so there'll no\nproblem.'
'Ah a way to turn things around!'
'What are you talking about?!'
Thank heavens a voice of reason.
'Phew... that was a close one.'
'You alright?'
'Yeah, you saved me. Thanks.'
'Jeez, everyone's getting way to excited.'
'The fact that they can get that crazy without\ndrinking. That's the scariest part.'
'Alcohol isn't the only way to lose control.\nJeez, what a strange bunch.'
'You can't say that! You're the only one who\ncan't say that!'
'Oh yeah. You were about to say something before,\nright? What was it?'
Caught off guard I get flustered.
'Ah that, well, that was...'
At a moment like this it's important to show\nguts.
After getting caught up in that stupid business I\nlost my wits and now I can't control my\nembarrassment.
'Hmm?'
'Well, it was like... something important.'
'Hey!'
'This seems to be the perfect time, so I guess\nI'll tell you now.'
'Kotori, do you want to fly?'
The mood immediately becomes tense.
'You mean... in the Morning Glory, right? That's\nwhat you mean?'
'Yeah.'
'... Yeah I do.'
Kotori replies frankly, barely taking a breath.
'I want to fly. I want to fly through the passage\nof clouds myself.'
'Got it. Well then, that's helped strengthen my\nown resolve.'
'Resolve?'
'I'm going to adjust the cockpit so that you\nwon't need to use your legs. You'll be able to\nfly it using just your upper body.'
'Really?! So, if you do that...'
'The plans have already been drawn up. Amane did\nit. The materials have been gathered, too.'
'All that was left was to confirm your intentions\nKotori.'
'But... in that case, the other pilot will be...'
'Aoi, of course.'
'But that would mean, Ageha... you...?'
'Well of course I want to fly. And I think the\nMorning Glory will be amazing. I really would\nlike to see it.'
'But physically we can only have two pilots. And\nthere will probably be only one chance.'
'With this in mind the one who should withdraw is\nme.'
'Are you OK with that?'
'Don't prod too much. I might change my mind.'
'Ah sorry, I wasn't trying to be mean.'
'Actually, more than flying I enjoy the\nconstruction process.'
'To create a new machine you have to do various\nthings. When you do that there really isn't much\ntime to practice flying.'
'I'll happily step down. It'll probably be better\nfor me this way.'
'Really... you're sure?'
'Yeah.'
Ageha goes outside and we follow her.
The moon shines in the night sky.
Unfortunately it isn't a full moon. But the sky\nis still quite bright.
'When I was younger, I often read boys' books.\nThe ones An-chan and Aoi read.'
'Stories about space and adventures. I still like\nthose kind of stories.'
'And... Aoi, what's the highest mountain in the\nworld?'
'Everest... in what's now Chomolungma is it?'
'Yeah. 8848 meters. And who were the first people\nto climb it?'
'Um... Hillary and Tenzing I think.'
'Correct. A British expedition in 1953.'
'Those two are famous. But do you know the names\nBourdillon and Evans?'
'Nope.'

'They were part of the same climbing expedition.
They were actually the first ones to try
attacking the summit. They gave up after reaching
8760 meters.'
'Hillary and Tenzing were actually the second\npeople to try. They embarked on their attempt\nafter the first pair returned.'
'And if they hadn't made it a third attempt was\nplanned. It was to be tried by Hunt and Noyce.'
'But the second pair succeeded. So Hillary and\nTenzing became the first to climb Everest.'
'Those two became world famous. But the others.\nNobody really remembers their names.'
'But those two. They didn't think they climbed it\nalone. They never thought that.'
'They said it was a brilliant achievement that\neveryone accomplished together.'

'More than that they said that they were riding
on others' shoulders. The shoulders of the
expeditions that had gone before them. That's
what they believed.'
'... The other people involved are so cool.\nThat's what I thought when I read that.'

'The ones who reached the top are amazing.
They're heroes. But those heroes didn't
accomplished it all on their own. It wasn't just
the two of them.'

'Until then so many people took the challenge,
tried new equipment with their own bodies. They
figured out the best way to climb while they did
it.'
'They followed along the routes set by people who\nwent before them. By doing that they managed to\nreach the top.'
'Because there were those people before them.\nThey were able to shine as heroes.'
'...I thought that to be one of those people,\nthat would be fine.'
'That would be amazing. That's what I've come to\nfeel in my heart over this past year.'
'Even if I'm not able to fly, if I can help those\nwho do, that would truly make me happy.'
'So I am going to do everything I can. I am going\nto make the best glider possible.'
'And I want you to fly it, Kotori. I want you to\ncontrol it.'
'In that way, in my own way, I'll be flying as\nwell.'
Kotori and I are lost for words.
Ageha... that she would feel this way...
'... Sorry.'
Kotori says, getting all choked up.
'I'll fly... I'm definitely going to fly.'
'I'm sorry, Ageha'
I say it from the bottom of my heart.
Ageha had been thinking this way while all I was\ndoing was thinking about myself.
'Let's fly. Let's make the dream we've had this\npast year come true.'
'Yeah!'
'I'll make it, our glider.'
We place our hands on top of each others and just\nwhen we were about to speak... we are\ninterrupted.
'Hey that's not fair. You guys can't get all\nexcited by yourselves.'
'Jeez, you drag us all along with your plans. But\nnow you're deciding this without consulting the\nrest of us?'
'... Sorry'
We all nod an apology at the other two.
'Alright then, c'mon Soaring Club, let's do\nthis!'
'Yeah!'
Oh boy, this is like before a sports game.
I think this but I can't deny that I feel my\nblood get hot with excitement.
...This is definitely not the place to confess my\nfeelings...
'Hmm?'
The smile Ageha gives as if she can see right\nthrough me is somewhat irritating.
And then...
'Yes!'
'Well that's good.'
'We did it!'
The exam results have been put out.
Everyone in the Soaring Club, me, the Kazato\nsisters, everyone. We all managed to avoid doing\nsupplementary exams.
'It was a close one though.'
'Yeah, I know.'
My own and Ageha's overall rankings are lined up\nnext to each other.
Had our rank been three positions lower we would\nhave had to take supplementary exams.
'Well anyways, you passed so don't sweat it.\nAlright, let's get to work!'
'Shh!'
As it's just before the closing ceremony, we've\nbeen hanging around here and preparing to immerse\nourselves in our project but...
As expected Ageha hasn't turned up today either.
Everyone is quietly absorbed in the construction\nof the glider or staring at simulators.
As I look at this... of course all I can think\nabout is Ageha.
It's here, in this place that we...
Building the glider is the first priority. That's\nour dream. So we'll do that first. Talking about\nfeelings and dating, that stuff can come later.
This is what Ageha said, and I understand where\nshe's coming from.
I was moved by her story about trying to take\nafter those mountain climbers.
But... still.
Only I have clearly and with every ounce of\ncourage confessed my feelings.
She could at least let me hear her reply, even if\nit was just one sentence.
I mean she told me that she didn't hate me, but\neven Ageha can't actually expect that I'd be\ncontent with just that.

Because saying that someone isn't a bad person or
that you don't hate them, these are the kinds of
things that you say to people when you reject
them.
Just one phrase would suffice.
'I like you" or "Sorry, I can't look at you in\nthat way, Aoi", either way I wouldn't mind.
Not knowing which one it is, being in this limbo,\nit's unbearable.
'I just want things to be clear.'
'Exactly.'
'Huh?!'
'Go out and clear your head.'
Kotori flatly points her finger to the door.
'Outside.'
'What about outside?'
'Get out is what I'm saying.'
'You're zoning out too much. I get that you're\nhappy exams are over. But all you're doing is\nsighing and staring off into space.'
'I'm getting tired of it. Go jump into the lake\nand snap out of it! This is an order from your\nleader.'
'Whoa...'
With that I walk outside.
'Man it's hot...'
Well, since it's the perfect opportunity, I'll\nhead to An-chan's factory.
He has the parts I asked for and he can teach me\nnew techniques and give me some professional\nadvice.
I can also tell him about the situation with\nAgeha and get some advice with that, too.
But unfortunately... he's not in.
And it seems he headed out to the secret base at\nthat.
'So we just passed each other...'
He took the parts that I asked for with him so I\nhead back empty handed.
'Go back to the secret base?... Hmm. Kind of\nfeels a bit pointless.'
'I think so too.'
'Right.'
'Whaaaa?!'
'Oh. Did I surprise you?'
'You totally did!'
'I can't believe you wouldn't notice me hiding in\nyour shadow. You have much to learn young Aoi.'
'What, skills like that?'
'It's one of the 48 secret techniques passed down\nin the Himegi family.'
'Of course one of those is the butt kick, that\nyou've witnessed.'
'Passed directly down from our mother. I'm\nproficient in that art now.'
'Well please don't try it out on me, OK?'
'Ah, how did you know I would?'
'Cause it's obvious!'
'Actually I'm here as an official monitor. I'm\nhere to keep an eye on you.'
'... Did Ageha put you up to this?'
'I am the only master of my own actions.'
'What comic did you read?'
'So in other words, you're following me around of\nyour own accord?'
'Wow, you're so clever Aoi.'
'Heh, the sophisticated Aoi Minase doesn't hang\naround with the Himegi sisters.'
Acting cool, I run my hand through my hair\ndespite the complete lack of wind.
'Lame.'
'That's mean.'
'That's the kind of thing beautiful people do.'
'You're actually pretty ruthless, aren't you?'
'Even if you don't do that kind of posing, you're\nstill cool. I like you.'
'Thanks, I understand.'
'My once in a lifetime confession is completely\nignored.'
'Ah, sorry...'
At that moment I feel a sharp pain in my heart.
... Once in a lifetime confession...
'You're right, when someone confesses their\nfeelings you should respond seriously.'
'My bad, Hotaru.'
'You're NOT forgiven.'
'Despite an apology being given.'
'If you want to be forgiven you have to come with\nme for a sec.'
'I was trying to get a rhyme started. Didn't\nquite happen, huh?'
'I want to go shopping... that OK?'
'Yeah I guess, I've got nothing else on, so I\ndon't mind.'
I send an e-mail to Kotori and walk alongside\nHotaru.
Hotaru wants to buy writing materials so we walk\naround those kind of shops.
'Done. Thank you so much for walking around with\nme.'
She gives a deep bow.
'It was nothing. Barely took any time at all.'
'In that regard you guys are similar, aren't\nyou?'
'You mean me and Ageha?'
'Yeah. You guys take a long time to inspect\nthings. But when it comes to decision time,\nyou're immediate. Very decisive.'
'Ah right...'
'Ah yeah, the other day... when you were spinning\nin my room. What was that?'
'... It's a secret.'
'Hey, it's my room.'
'It's a girl's secret.'
'You were doing it in my room. I think I have the\nright to know what it was.'
'No you don't. Statute of Limitations. It never\nhappened. It's disappeared into thin air. So I\ncan't tell you.'
'Hmmm? Well if you say it like that, I really\nwant to know what it was now.'
'Ah, Aoi, you want to become a beast! An absolute\nmonster!'
Normally I would just throw something equally\nridiculous back at her but...
I recall that moment with Ageha... how she looked\nbacked then...
The girl in front of me is her sister, so they\nundeniably resemble each other...
'No I don't! I wouldn't do anything like that!'
I become completely flustered.
'No, I mean, like...'
'Aoi, you're weird.'
'No, like, you see...'
'Did something happen between you and Ageha?'
'No, of course not, nothing, really.'
Ah, her eyes don't believe me at all.
'I'll tell you what the spinning was. You tell me\nwhat happened with Ageha, OK?'
'That, that kind of agreement is...'
'I was rolling around on your bed.'
'... At that time. In my room?'
'Yeah, in the same place that you hugged me. I\nwas remembering that and rolling around.'
'That's what you were doing?'
'Yeah, so now that I've told you my secret, you\nhave to tell me yours.'
'Aoi, you're an honest and fair person, right?'
'I just told you a really embarrassing story. You\ncan't just let me be the only one.'
'Did you learn this kind of verbal barrage from\nAgeha?'
'This is the true form of all women.'
'I don't particularly like it.'
'Is the true way of all men to turn into beasts?'
'There isn't a country in the world where that's\na man's true form!'
'Lame.'
'You want me to get angry?'
'Doesn't bother me, I can take anything you throw\nat me.'
'Hey, let's not do this kind of thing in public.'
Phew, I wipe the sweat from my brow.
This isn't good, she can keep pace with me\ncompletely.
In the end this began because I got flustered. I\nneed to regroup.
'... Anyway, I'm surprised you've become able to\ntalk like this. You've changed Hotaru.'
'Yeah a little I guess. It's because of you.'
'Why me?'
'If a girl falls in love she grows up.'
'Love, right...'
'I didn't realize it back then.'
Thinking back, it makes me think of when Ageha\ncame here.
'Around here, back when the secret base was\nhere.'
'Yeah, I remember.'
These two really are sisters. They bring up the\nsame things.
Well I guess we've all had the same experiences\nso it makes sense.
'It's too bad that it was destroyed, isn't it...?\nEven though we're playing around in the ruins.'
'It was fun back then.'
'Was it? We forced you along with everything we\ndid. Wasn't that a bit hard?'
'Not at all. It was fun.'
'Ageha, Aoi, Tasaki and those guys. I liked\nwatching you all.'
'Really. Well I'm glad...'
'I miss those days.'
'It's because I wasn't there when it got\ndestroyed... seeing it go. I can't really get my\nhead around it.'
'Did you see it? The secret base actually getting\ndestroyed?'
'Um... Aoi... You know what happened right?'
'Hmm? What do you mean?'
'When it was destroyed... how Ageha was...'
I shake my head slightly.
'Did... something happen?'
'You didn't hear?'
'No, nothing.'
A shadow crosses Hotaru's face that I have never\nseen before.
Turmoil... fear... realizing she let something\nslip... all those things are mixed up in her\nexpression.
'Hey, c'mon. What is it? Did something happen?'
Aside from Ageha, I haven't heard anything from\nAn-chan or Ma-kun either.
'Something happened, didn't it.'
Just from looking at Hotaru's expression it's\nobvious.
'So... it's something that she doesn't want me to\nknow?'
'I'm sorry.'
'I'm not angry. It's Ageha's business, right?\nBasically it's something that I don't know about,\nisn't it?'
'Well if you don't know what I'm talking about...\nthen, yeah.'
'Thought so...'
'Why didn't you tell me?'
Hotaru responds timidly but firmly.
'If Ageha didn't tell you there's no way I can.'
'I guess the fact that An-chan and Ma-kun didn't\ntell me was for the same reason.'
Without thinking I clench my fist.
One year. It's been a year since I returned to\nthis town.
I thought that I'd already managed to fill the\nvacuum I'd left when I'd gone away.
But there's still things that I don't know. That\nare being hidden from me.
Everyone got their stories straight behind my\nback.
'What?... What is it?... What happened?!...'
'You want to know?'
'Yeah I want to know! Tell me!'
'Then... let me ask you one thing.'
'Fine!'
'I want you to take me out on a date.'
'Date? You mean you and me together, that kind of\ndate?'
'Yeah, that kind of date. I want you to take me\nout.'
'That's... your trade off?'
'Yeah it is. I know it's dirty but I don't care.\nIf you take me on a date I'll tell you.'
'No, I can't do that.'
Ageha is no longer just another person to me.
Even if it wasn't her sister, I can't just go out\non a date with another girl.
'You can't?'
'Sorry.'
'Got it.'
'Alright then I'll think of some other way.'
'Hey!'
'I'm not going to give up.'
'I'd really prefer you would.'
'The woman near me is telling me that I can't\ngive up now.'
'What woman?'
'One that's really good at butt kicks it would\nseem.'
'That's, that's the woman who's living in your\nhouse, right?'
Though I guess around this time she's working on\nthe first floor in Himegi Sports.
'Though I guess if she's living at yours it's\ndangerous for me.'
'Yes it is. So you better take me out on a date.'
'I told you I can't'
I say clearly then place my hand on Hotaru's\nhead.
'Hey... patting me is cowardly... Eek, eek.'
'You're so cute and small Hotaru, aren't you. A\ncute little one.'
'Mmmm... that's unfair...'
'I'm sorry. Instead of the date you'll have to be\nsatisfied with this.'
'I'll just have to ask Ageha myself. But if that\ndoesn't work I'll ask you again, OK?'
Hotaru nods, her face completely serene.
Of course I call Ageha as soon as I part with\nHotaru.
'Can you talk?'
'Yeah... no problem.'
'Are you busy with something?'
'I'm not doing anything overly difficult so it's\nOK.'
'Right, well... it has nothing to do with what we\ntalked about the other day.'
'Oh it isn't?'
'Before that there's something I want to ask you\nabout.'
'Are you hiding something from me?'
'Hiding something? Like what?'
'It has something to do with the secret base.'
I can tell clearly that Ageha has caught her\nbreath.
'After I went away... something happened, right?'
'No... nothing.'
'...Look, you can try to gloss over it. You can\nkeep silent. But please don't lie. I don't want\nto be lied to by someone I like.'
When I say this Ageha falls completely silent.
'So, what happened?'
'Back when I had to change schools, when the\nsecret base was destroyed... it was then, right?'
'It's something that you can't tell me?'
Ageha still doesn't say anything.
'Why have you kept it from me until now?'
'Why is it something that you can't tell me? Is\nit something that you think would hurt me,\nsomething like that?'
'It's not that... Nothing like that...'
'Then why can't you tell me?'
'If you don't tell me I'll find out on my own.'
'Who did you hear this from? Ma-kun? Hotaru?'
'What difference does it make?!'
'It makes a huge difference!'
'Don't change the topic.'
'...You're hiding a whole lot from me, aren't\nyou?'
'You told me the other day that they're things\nbest not to know. But that doesn't sit well with\nme.'
'Well anyways, at the moment I'm getting a little\nhot headed. I won't delve any deeper than\nthis...'
To regain my cool at a moment like this is a\nremnant of my racing days.
'The next time I see you we're going to talk face\nto face and you're going to tell me, okay?'
With that I end the call.
I thought Ageha would say something but in the\nend she stayed silent.
This makes me even more irritated than before. So\nI called her with my cell phone again.
Then I immediately make another call.
'Hey, Hotaru? What we talked about before,\nactually it's OK.'
'I'll take you out on a date. Just the two of us.\nLet's go out somewhere.'
